name: Sands Casino Resort Bethlehem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went there to celebrate my boyfriend's 40th birthday. It's easy to find, the parking is free! Rooms are very nice. The bed was very comfortable. Free Continental breakfast (served daily), which they kept replenishing.
reviews.title: Good time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner at Emeril's Italian Table and the service was great. Food was delicious.
reviews.title: Overpriced Eurotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downside is that other than the gambling, there isn't much of a nightlife. The mall isn't supposed to be ready until November.
reviews.title: Great Night At Sands Casino & Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All is all, we will be going back.
reviews.title: Good location, modern facility, but could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The check-in area looks like an office. The hotel and casino are located in the old steel factory area. The room is clean and the TV is great. The shower does not have good lighting and there is no tub. There are no ledges or areas to place anything in the shower. Don't even try to shave your legs in there !You have to insert your room card for electricity, heat or air conditioning, so ask for an extra card for this purpose. The garbage cans don't have plastic bags. The casino is small; go for the bus trip; save your money on the room. There are no other motels close to the casino. The place looks better on the internet than it does in reality !
reviews.title: Out of the ruins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sands offers very nice accommodations and a jumping casino in Bethlehem, PA. I rated the property "Very Good", but with a few exceptions. The rooms were spacious and well-appointed, however, finding the entrance to the hotel was another story. The lobby door is very understated and we drove right past it. When we arrived around 12:30 on Saturday afternoon there was no valet nor bellman to be found. Our biggest complaint, however, was the high stakes required to play craps. $15 and $25 were the only denominations offered on Sat., 2/4 and Sun., 2/5. (Even Atlantic City offers at least one $10 table!!!) Early Sunday morning, it was the same pricing. As a result we were very disappointed not to be able to play our favorite game! It will definitely stop us from returning.
reviews.title: Sands Pa - The Good and The Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are clean and comfortable , room service breakfast was good. Emril's Chophouse is a very good dinner option. We dined there several times the steaks are quality and don't miss the banana creme pie! The casino is too smokey and packed. The crowd reflects the rural location.
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Visited the Sands Casino on Tuesday (1/31/12). This was my first time there. I was very suprised at how large the casino was. Most of the slot machines were in banks of four and very spacious. You really should walk around at first to take in all the different machines they have. Of course, I started with the slots as soon as I walked in and settled on the area near the entrance doors. They have many of the newer slots and that's why it's a good idea to walk around and find the ones you like most. The Casino is clean and even though smoking is allowed, the place is so large it really doesn't affect you. They have a food court, a few of Emeril's places and the Carnige Deli, where we had a wonderful "early dinner special" for $15 which included a starter, a sandwhich and a dessert. Definitely worth the money.
reviews.title: The Sands Casino is sooooo Big

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I did not end up a winner, I enjoyed gambling there very much.
reviews.title: Nice But.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Hotel is a beautiful place. We had a King room.....We had a smoking room, and I will say, as soon as you came off the elevator, you could smell that you were on a smoking floor. The room is spacious and the bed was sooooo comfortable, I would ask for extra pillows though. Ice machines are at the end of the hallway on every floor, so it is convenient. There is room service and it is average price wise. The hotel does not look like it is done yet. Elevator service was quick, You really always need to remeber to have room keys with you everywhere. To get to the rooms, you have to have your key. The hotel provides a free continental breakfast, buffet style, in a room overlooking the massive grounds of Bethlehem steel . I rated the hotel four instead of five. To get to the casino you have to walk through a large, two level shopping plaza and then through the Marketplace food court. We don't mind walking, but since the mall just recently opened, most of the storefronts are empty. It just gave a negative impression. I would not be able to bring my aging mother here to stay, becasue of the long walk. I thought the person at check in just seemed like we were bothering her which is not a way to be when you have a new hotel and are trying to get said hotel off the ground. Lots of choices to eat, but everything even quick food was really pricey.One thing I will say, I don't know if I would pay their full price for a room. It is just a little pricey for the basically only staff you see is the front desk. They do have alot of security, so you can feel safe here.
reviews.title: very comfortable overnight in Bethlehem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The only thing I will add is that when we were staying at the hotel they had construction starting at 5:00 am in the morning waking you up and when we asked why so early said they were under deadline with the construction of the convention center.
reviews.title: Ditto previous review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people were very helpful and friendly. The walk is very very long for someone who has a problem walking, and is elderly walking back to the room at night especially a women by themselves.
reviews.title: Very good, not quite excellent, yet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to spend a night at the new Sands Hotel in Bethlehem, PA. I was somewhat apprehensive because of some of the more negative reviews, but we decided to give it a try anyway. Because I'm responding to much of the criticism, this will be a rather long review. First, let me say this; this is a casino hotel which is designed for casino guests. This would not be my first choice if I was coming here with young children. Casinos are adult playgrounds, period. Don't expect this to be a Disney hotel.
reviews.title: New and modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as the hotel itself, it is a medium size hotel, with about 300 rooms, in a small metropolitan area. If you are expecting expansive lobbies with crystal chandelieres and waterfalls, then go to a hotel with thousands of rooms in Las Vegas or Atlantic City. What you do have here is a very modern & attractive hotel, with a pleasant check-in experience and very friendly front desk staff. As mentioned by other reviewers, there really isn't one long desk, but instead there are three desks with comfortable chairs to sit in while you are checked in.
reviews.title: Convenient and nice, but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: They have hotel valet parking (for a fee), not to be confused with the valet parking at the casino entrance. If you opt to park yourself, there is a large outdoor lot right behind the hotel., well lit and casino security can be seen patrolling at night. At the other end of what is a large and expansive property, the casino has a multi-level indoor garage.
reviews.title: so close so fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually stay at the Holiday Inn nearby since there is a shuttle to the casino, but we stayed at the Sands Casino/Hotel as a "try it once" treat. The check-in was fast because we used the kiosk (there was a line for the desk check-in). The room was very nice and the bed was comfy. It was a short walk to the casino/food court. Although this is a positive review of the Sands Hotel I will go back to the Holiday Inn because it is much less expensive, has a shuttle to the casino....and free breakfast!
reviews.title: "Casino Hotel"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel but they don't have the little things you would find in a Vegas style hotel. We stayed in a king room. It is a large room with a dresser/desk, bed, and two chairs. It looks like they intended the room to have a small table and chairs in the corner but decided not to do it. It's just a big empty spot... sort of looks strange. The dresser/desk combo has a door that looks like it would have a mini fridge in it but again, looks like they changed their minds. When you open the door, it's an empty spot. Some of the higher priced rooms do have the mini fridge. Why would they skimp on the fridges? Even the cheap motels have them. The bathroom is big and has a nice shower in it with lots of room but the sink area is outside of the bathroom and very small. There's no way two people could get ready at the same time in the sink area. We didn't use the pool or the exercise equipment but it looked pretty standard. The check in area has desks rather than a counter. It's a nice touch. They do have an express check in kiosk but it wasn't working when we arrived. They also have a free continental breakfast but it is pretty skimpy. They room it is located in doesn't have near enough room to handle all of the people. As a result, lots of people were eating standing up or sitting on the floor in the hall! These types of things would never happen in Vegas but they have a captured audience here. The hotel is connected to a high end outlet mall. Most of the shops are still empty as it was just completed but it looks like it will be pretty nice once more stores move in. After you pass through the mall, you walk into the food court area and then onto the casino. I would stay here again but would not expect the Vegas hotel experience.
reviews.title: Nice but don't expect a Vegas style hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to the Sands this past weekend on an overnight. Hotel is nice but needs a touch here and there nothing serious. More light in the bathroom, better location od towel racks and better seal on shower door. Casino was jumping with live music Sunday night and the restaurants were busy. Food is also very good in the Marketplace food court.
reviews.title: A Work in Progress

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you get tired of the casino there is a shuttle to downtown Bethlehem for $4.00 and its good all day. They have opened the Steel Stacks theater within walking distance and have a pretty ful schedule of events. Interesting to see how they've worked the old steel mill into to mix in all the areas. Working with the constant pressure of maintaining the steel mill history of the area into their plan is a little challenging but they're doing a good job. When they finish the entire 124 acres along the river it should be really something.
reviews.title: Average Casino Hotel - Not Bad for Bethlehem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in early November for a quick getaway. We did some hiking in the area and visited a local winery along with spending some time in the casino. The casino itself. The casino was very smoky which was a problem for us. The smoke-free section was very small and didn't have the table games with the lower limits that the smoking section had. We spent a little time in the pool, but there was no jacuzzi which was a huge disappointment since I had called to ask about the hotel having a jacuzzi, only to find that they only have an indoor pool. Not realy what I was looking for.
reviews.title: Average

description: The Sands Casino Resort Bethlehem designed its hotel to set a new standard for luxury and style. Complimentary Continental Breakfast and Wireless Internet are included. The 302 rooms include 16 Executive Suites and 6 Presidential Suites, each of which has the latest in modern amenities like wireless internet, media-hubs and high-definition flat-screen televisions. When you select the Sands Casino Resort Bethlehem you are assured an extraordinary experience. Each of the resort's spacious guest rooms is sophisticatedly decorated in a stylish combination of rich dark woods and neutral tones - the perfect choice for a weekend escape or business retreat. Luxury, Style and Class come together to create an unparalleled hotel in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. The Sands offers a wide array of dining from casual to upscale at five distinct locations and the convenience of a food court. Savor a tender cut of prime steak or fresh seafood at Emeril's Chop House. Visit Chef Emeril Lagasse's newest restaurant, Emeril's Italian Table, with its rustic Italian-inspired fare including antipasti, cured meats and artisanal cheeses, fresh made pastas and more. Enjoy a distinctive twist on all-American favorites at Burgers And More by Emeril. Stop by St. James Gate Irish Pub and Carvery for an authentic Irish meal. The Sands is home to a New York City iconic eatery, Carnegie Deli - the perfect stop for something quick and delicious.
